My code is complaining about step 9.c in the new [String.prototype.split](https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-string.prototype.split): `_codeUnits_` appears to be a List in which each element is a code unit, but  CreateArrayFromList wants a List in which each element is an ECMAScript language value. Don't we need wording that makes a String value for each code unit?
content.formatted_body: My code is complaining about step 9.c in the new String.prototype.split: _codeUnits_ appears to be a List in which each element is a code unit, but CreateArrayFromList wants a List in which each element is an ECMAScript language value. Don't we need wording that makes a String value for each code unit?

content.body: isn't a String just a sequence of code units?
altho i guess there's at least one Note where it adds "converted to a String"
the intro para in https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-ecmascript-language-types-string-type seems like it does define a String as a sequence of integers, where each integer is considered a code unit
even then, strictly speaking a code unit is not a sequence of code units

so "Let _codeUnits_ be a List consisting of the sequence of code units that are the elements of _head_." â†’ "Let _codeUnits_ be a List consisting of the sequence of code units that are the elements of _head_, each converted to a String."?
content.formatted_body: so "Let codeUnits be a List consisting of the sequence of code units that are the elements of head." â†’ "Let codeUnits be a List consisting of the sequence of code units that are the elements of head, each converted to a String."?

content.body: "converted to a string" isn't really precise enough
